name: ListIncidentAlerts
description:
Retrieve a list of alerts for a specific incident.

Use this tool to get alerts related to a particular incident, which represents a problem requiring attention and resolution. Useful for monitoring and managing ongoing issues.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the incident to retrieve alerts.

parameters.name: accept_versioning_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to accept using the 'Accept' header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the format of the content. Use 'application/json' for JSON format.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of alert results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination for search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: alert_deduplication_key
parameters.description: A unique key used for alert de-duplication in incident management.

parameters.name: alert_statuses
parameters.description: Return only alerts with the specified statuses. Accepts 'triggered' or 'resolved'.

value_schema.description: Return only alerts with the given statuses. (More status codes may be introduced in the future.)

parameters.name: sort_incident_alerts
parameters.description: Specify the field (created_at/resolved_at) and direction (asc/desc) to sort alerts. Use a colon ':' to separate field and direction, and a comma ',' if using two fields.

value_schema.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (created_at/resolved_at), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma. Sort direction defaults to ascending.

parameters.name: additional_details_to_include
parameters.description: List of additional details to include, such as 'services', 'first_trigger_log_entries', and 'incidents'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: populate_total_field
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses for accurate count, set to false for faster responses.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: statuses[]
parameters.description: Return only alerts with the given statuses. (More status codes may be introduced in the future.)

value_schema.description: Return only alerts with the given statuses. (More status codes may be introduced in the future.)

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (created_at/resolved_at), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma. Sort direction defaults to ascending.

value_schema.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (created_at/resolved_at), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma. Sort direction defaults to ascending.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
